document.title: Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Standards

0E9FE5D2AF254B9395C6C2770BD1C57C.description:
Evaluate a habitat to determine
its ecological quality and if it is threatened.

337A5CB950AC4D7E9B94EC9919B691CE.description:
Assess different measurements
of assessing ecological health (e.g.,
quadrat biodiversity assessments, transect
surveys, population counts, detection of disease
and invasive species, etc.) to determine
their effectiveness and limitations.

D02D22CA7A304707AA8E6F8652D5D06E.description:
Research and summarize
methods used to determine ecological health
and determine if an ecosystem is threatened
(e.g., quadrat analysis, bioindicators, mark-recapture,
etc.).

F1C5B71816BE47B3A10B3A1D1BFECC5F.description:
Perform an evaluation of air
quality to determine and assess its impact of
human and ecological populations.

FA12974F41A748A098CDB8D8C7A57446.description:
Assess different measurements
of air quality (e.g., ozone, carbon monoxide,
particulate matter, etc.) to determine
their effectiveness and limitations.

7CDD9DBF383244EDA1BD10F5B5100B9B.description:
Research and summarize
methods and tools used to determine air
quality and determine if pollution is present
(e.g., CO2 probe, particulate matter sampler,
etc.).

C33DCE5B4A8044BEBB23FB56344228F3.description:
Evaluate a sample of soil to
determine its quality and if it has been contaminated.

B6FAA9BC30A04B32BFA0AB2A1DE7C92F.description:
Assess different measurements
of soil quality (e.g., soil horizons, soil
texture, organic matter, soil respiration, etc.)
to determine their effectiveness and limitations.

7DA16920D1B742BB9D1164C25BBC3DDB.description:
Research and summarize
methods and tools used to measure soil
health and determine if an area of land has
been contaminated (e.g., soil probes, core
monolith, soil fertility tests, etc.).

B4A6488530D3456F90643D551641D5CA.description:
Evaluate a sample of water
to determine its quality and if it has been
contaminated.

3AC6046D93304E5D8D509389A8B5DE99.description:
Research and summarize
methods used to determine water quality
(e.g., dissolved oxygen, chemical tests,
macroinvertebrates, etc.) and determine if a
source of water has been contaminated.

E3C5CB2F77D84B9EA84519BD56033623.description:
Research and summarize
methods used to determine water quality
(e.g., dissolved oxygen, chemical tests,
macroinvertebrates, etc.) and determine if a
source of water has been contaminated.

51E21836CD2944EE9F03FC487E5FDBAA.description:
Perform assessments of environmental conditions using equipment, machinery and
technology.

0598DA98B6A14D22B5CD64373B8CC9F5.description:
Evaluate trends in technology
and develop predictions about how these
advancements will change environmental
service systems.

A00A2F3A931A46ABBA2CFB037534E0F8.description:
Analyze and document examples
of utilization of breaking technology
in environmental service systems.

AE4ABD9010CE4179ABDBB5151EBC2AC2.description:
Research how advancements
in technology (e.g., unmanned aerial vehicles
and drones, genetic modification, fracking,
alternative energy, etc.) have changed environmental
service systems.

7B9BD046375A4B5B849C8690DE97C6E3.description:
Interpret and evaluate GIS
data to come to a conclusion about a scenario
specific to environmental service systems.

0955C08739CE4C2F8EC049299BCC94FE.description:
Apply GIS skills to a situation
specific to environmental service systems.

491350565D2C4700B658E963C9F4EC64.description:
Research the methods in
which GIS can be used in environmental
service systems (e.g., tracing of point pollution,
control of the spread of invasive species,
etc.).

573D2A0516384058978C3FE5CACA09D9.description:
Demonstrate surveying and
cartographic skills to make site measurements
in order to address concerns and
needs within an environmental service systems
situation.

DDB000C1F39E4FDC99B0F9F009C8D839.description:
Apply surveying and mapping
principles to a situation involving environmental
service systems and identify and
explain the use of equipment for surveying
and mapping.

2F5E04697CBE4ED5A36A82E19605A884.description:
Examine the importance and
describe applications of surveying and mapping
for environmental service systems.

DCEFAE539D644FB9AB51B4446BD62154.description:
Use technological and mathematical tools to map land, facilities and infrastructure
for environmental service systems.

791C924F14814AA1AFC136A0DDF06CF3.description:
Use tools, equipment, machinery and technology common to tasks in
environmental service systems.

B85EA94C53EE48288E5961E89B73CBD2.description:
Conduct a life cycle assessment
for a given source of energy and use
this assessment to determine the best option
for energy in regards to environmental service
systems.

7BC7BCE78FA44B25A26398B258C274FB.description:
Interpret a life cycle assessment
and explain how it can be utilized
in environmental service systems to assess
the potential ecological impact of an energy
source.

4035E4F2F95F46949B100612C318FA17.description:
Research and describe the
purpose and applications of life cycle assessments
to environmental service systems.

072885965B1546119456C8FDBCF7EC0B.description:
Use data from environmental
monitoring to evaluate methods for reducing
the imbalance in the carbon cycle through
changes to energy consumption.

8B37ED57C32E4C5485C0BD43ECA2326B.description:
Calculate the impact of
the carbon cycle imbalance (due to energy
consumption) and assess how this imbalance
affects environmental service systems.

EA05B5406D5D445787DEDC87BE61D465.description:
Examine and explain how
energy consumption and the carbon cycle
relate to environmental monitoring.

BC6F15BC25914EAF83AAFB175079B8E9.description:
Devise a strategy for improving
future energy consumption in a
manner consistent with the intents of environmental
service systems.

61452B9BC40D41D59C5B8EB0808637CB.description:
Analyze and document the
most significant impacts that energy consumption
has on environmental monitoring.

36BA387B28C64EBA88DFE635C9F14118.description:
Research the impact on
environmental service systems that occur
because of energy consumption.

4FECB1BFE1F44BA1994E80906E4727FF.description:
Evaluate strategies for reducing
energy consumption to determine the
most effective course of action based on the
needs of environmental service systems.

3D20F6CEA579445DA5A2C0E6B25B6EFC.description:
Analyze and document the
main categories of energy consumption.

A8F67FAA52FE4F78B381FEC42C968749.description:
Examine the factors that
affect energy consumption and describe how
these factors are related to environmental
monitoring.

D93DD793590B4307AEFB44D46E8369B0.description:
Evaluate the impact alternative
energy sources have on environmental
conditions.

867667957684438F9399FA4B40A5BC4F.description:
Research alternative energy
sources and describe the motivations for
seeking alternatives to conventional energy
sources as they relate to environmental monitoring.

7EFAC4CAEEDC4585B930981B84703600.description:
Identify advantages and
disadvantages of alternative energy sources
as they pertain to environmental service
systems.

F07F631804EA47D1B8DB437D25702892.description:
Evaluate the impact burning
of fossil fuels has on environmental service
systems.

498BA59B2C704CBFA2224C2993A566CD.description:
Assess the advantages
and disadvantages of conventional energy
sources in regards to environmental service
systems.

E2C5C4A81B95438D97D2732F38C5293D.description:
Research conventional energy
sources and list conservation measures to
reduce the impact on environmental service
systems.

F960ECD853B044EEBD830138DBA168AE.description:
Compare and contrast the impact of conventional and alternative energy sources
on the environment and operation of environmental service systems.

7BE7836512EA453D84C0A6DCA0022DB1.description:
Evaluate examples of wastewater
and/or septic waste for its potential to
cause environmental, economic and/or social
problems.

08982DF38E194E28855E08DF2A4F718B.description:
Analyze and document the
steps necessary to ensure that wastewater
and septic waste can be safely released into
the environment.

1A61666C289B40CB93383A252961476E.description:
Research methods commonly
used to treat wastewater and septic waste.

1A2DA5EAA76C43458D75A3FFC0E5FC0D.description:
Evaluate samples of water
and the processes necessary to verify that
the samples are safe for consumption according
to applicable standards.

D2D001F7C4C84A078D4C2154953D3061.description:
Analyze and document all
steps in the public drinking water treatment
process according to applicable standards.

3555010849ED4F8AAFB746C5D78700B3.description:
Categorize chemical and
physical properties of drinking water.

9E0D4D41AFDA4CCDBD75BB22702182BD.description:
Apply techniques to ensure a safe supply of drinking water and adequate treatment
of wastewater according to applicable rules and regulations.

A7D5683AF1CA49B090C9E6AAC93062F0.description:
Survey and evaluate recycling
programs and procedures.

0D64A249A325495E8C823CD1C98A6D5F.description:
Analyze and document different
recycling methods and classify materials
that can be recycled.

FA64D931222746E6818090F5437690D8.description:
Examine and describe the
importance and potential impact of recycling.

DFF4DF503E0C4281A4B3BCFB3B279B45.description:
Evaluate the appropriateness
of composting methods in different situations.

351A39B876294F4D8CD8D8A0E6D7C62B.description:
Apply scientific principles to
explain the benefits and processes of composting.

2DE7DF876D1543F38791A12C3150A731.description:
Research and summarize the
benefits and processes of composting.

C2E342AED27F437EB19526EE22C437ED.description:
Evaluate sanitary landfill
procedures for environmental, economic and
social sustainability

7AE6B277920C4C3A9E2F82819B788193.description:
Analyze and document basic
sanitary landfill operating procedures and
design.

177B33893C784E11AB3B33841B0C2BEF.description:
Examine and describe the
components of disposing waste in sanitary
landfills.

871C51B1E0D9405DB82CCF4A67E48032.description:
Develop a plan for solid
waste disposal for a given situation that considers
the environmental hazards, economic
realities and social concerns associated with
this task.

3EB9AE22DB25427DB754B5ED79570497.description:
Analyze environmental hazards
created by different types of solid waste,
solid waste accumulation and solid waste
disposal.

51F1BC7F115C4CED9C43639DA9DCEA76.description:
Compare and contrast different
types of solid waste and options for
treating solid waste.

35153F4812994DA6A52A45C55C5E9313.description:
Manage safe disposal of all categories of solid waste in environmental service
systems.

593FF4F46D314204A5EB86B8D073B3F1.description:
Construct a plan for handling
hazardous waste in given situations.

541E386A1A0F41EFAF9641AF01E1E893.description:
Classify examples of pollution
as hazardous or nonhazardous.

321AFEA105C74F20900AD6A82E993BF4.description:
Interpret the conditions necessary
for waste to be labeled as hazardous.

CEC5FBDE1D4F4A51AE9502A8D0277935.description:
Create a plan for pollution
remediation, management or prevention for a
given area.

F921F8172E134411A2A605C0EFF11146.description:
Conduct tests to determine
the presence and extent of pollution.

D063ADA9A18344D5A3E3663C80B9EA69.description:
Research ways in which
pollution can be managed and prevented and
propose solutions to meet the needs of local
systems.

FDA2A49995194F0D90B412B9D9E1E524.description:
Evaluate evidence for a given
area for industrial and nonindustrial pollution.

D5BCD3C1DD944B41B54F4CD4094D4DDA.description:
Assess how industrial and
nonindustrial pollution has damaged the
environment.

D253D1E6130C4A7ABB22E5EF37643238.description:
Identify and distinguish types
of pollution and distinguish between point
source and nonpoint source pollution.

8EDAD57FCAE74DF7AF636A3FC431C2ED.description: Use pollution control measures to maintain a safe facility and environment.

0EAE9D29520E41969020961534113D26.description:
Demonstrate the operation of environmental service systems (e.g.,
pollution control, water treatment, wastewater treatment, solid waste
management and energy conservation).

6483A1D8701143168CABD9A8982977D2.description:
Utilize evidence from bioindicator
species to detect pollutants in a given
area.

7065931CA3EA4ECDBA8B1F31827025D7.description:
Evaluate the benefits and
drawbacks of using bioindicator species in
environmental service systems.

DDC255931B684687929BC2C61A7BD149.description:
Examine and describe how
ecological interactions can be used to assess
environmental service systems (i.e., macroinvertebrates
and/or amphibians as bioindicators).

567AD15BAD9C4AF0869BFFEA28E1CE96.description:
Devise a strategy for monitoring
and supporting environmental service
systems through management of a species’
carrying capacity.

221847AA72924BC8ACF26998F4998B16.description:
Assess and describe the
impact of a population exceeding its carrying
capacity on environmental service systems.

D5F4A3B40FC544AD9EF9FBE9063CB358.description:
Research and explain how
carrying capacities relate to environmental
service systems (e.g., waste processing, rate
or production of pollution, disease, etc.).

509B69908ECD456292956211249F3A60.description:
Evaluate the importance of
habitat to environmental service systems and
devise strategies to minimize the future loss
of habitats.

4393F68D0DD34F12809D76C603FA643B.description:
Assess the impact of the
current rate of hab

582785336DD54C9E806ED2A3E9D54BAA.description:
Examine and explain the role
played by habitats on environmental service
systems.

531E22C52F0C49C7BB32DBE4AC6E4C74.description:
Evaluate the biodiversity of
an area and predict the impact of changing
the levels of biodiversity on environmental
service systems.

84C1D3AE5FC84201AA9015AF86972E2A.description:
Calculate the amount of biodiversity
in a given area using an appropriate
method (e.g., quadrat assessment, transect
measurements, etc.).

2022260DF19A4A37B76E61D6DFDC4D1C.description:
Research the role that biodiversity
plays in environmental service systems
and how biodiversity can be measured.

58AFF78187774FC5A0D0197C6DE1DA61.description: Apply ecology principles to environmental service systems.

1F9BCBA6AD6C4101AFA0D76D112FCE6A.description:
Conduct bioassay tests
related to environmental service systems and
interpret results.

BBB9795E14CA4DCDA6CFFC68ECD204C9.description:
Analyze procedures for a
bioassay test.

CD4139FF8D454AF6B102E0175B66A8BA.description:
Research the purposes of
bioassay tests and describe potential applications
for environmental service systems.

5AFFC322E36B4B72A6A372D51C439F36.description:
Evaluate modern uses of
microbial waste water treatment and devise
strategies to further reduce the environmental,
economic and social impact of wastewater
treatment.

21118CB536524BBDAEE0524869AD065C.description:
Assess the impact of wastewater
treatment on environmental service
systems.

DA74A53C223B4DDD9A79480B62C2A9F8.description:
Examine and explain the role
that microbes play in wastewater treatment.

F70BC4BE2E954B3D88A47F9251B44C1D.description:
Develop strategies for negating
air pollutants based on soil microbial
populations (e.g., carbon sequestration and
rates of decomposition).

32D801235C9842AFABA9A3EB25D46B11.description:
Analyze the microbial populations
present in an area and assess how
carbon cycling is affected.

34EF56277E61436899D74D44B3C01D01.description:
Research and describe how
microbial populations in an ecosystem affect
carbon cycling.

360261D25B274609B44791E3E61AB099.description:
Evaluate how soil microorganisms
in environmental service systems can
be used to minimize waste, maximize nutrient

B3487441215942888E2AC3663981E31E.description:
Assess how the activities of
microorganisms in soil affect environmental
service systems and ecosystem biodiversity.

81AF700DC375417DBC37BA1E271F23BD.description:
Describe the microbial
biodiversity found in soil and summarize the
contribution of microbial biodiversity to the
physical and chemical characteristics of soil.

CC096879B162460EA106EC0374192B29.description: Apply microbiology principles to environmental service systems.

CFF5F259C62345998F3D75D0D9C4C04D.description:
Evaluate the services provided
by types of wetlands and predict how different
types of wetlands respond to pressures
due to human activity.

26EBE305A06E48F4883304A4FC091116.description:
Assess how different kinds
of wetlands are formed based on the different
kinds of soil and water chemistry present
in each case.

00BB5D208E974E4D887D5C878E2B2A2F.description:
Examine and summarize the
relationship between water and soil chemistry
and the formation of different kinds of wetlands
(e.g., fens, peat bogs, potholes, etc.).

EBC440BAFBD34CEBA030606A31B49C2F.description:
Assess the impact of atmospheric
chemistry on operational decisions in
environmental service systems.

3A7400CC131041D6B538648128FC378B.description:
Analyze how components
of atmospheric chemistry (e.g., air chemical
components, heat, moisture, etc.) affect air
quality.

6FA7CF7079254CCBB43FAA82410B5038.description:
Examine and summarize how
chemistry affects air quality and function
(e.g., heat retention, formation of smog and
acid rain, etc.).

1D285677AF564A2597C09E188F06EBD6.description:
Evaluate a sample’s water
chemistry and assess how the results may impact
considerations in environmental service
systems.

2E4CC1D0458849D5B5502569AC019379.description:
Analyze the water chemistry
of a sample.

2564ED63B64F4019B4438169DADE37F2.description:
Examine and summarize how
chemistry affects water quality and function
(e.g., oxygen saturation, pH, biomagnification,
etc.).

C72A142F9F7041D8A7D274D0D732C9AB.description:
Evaluate a sample’s soil
chemistry and assess how the results may impact
considerations in environmental service
systems.

BE59811D2F9D42CEB97FDB41B579B2EF.description:
Analyze the soil chemistry of
a sample.

D1A9312B6256489FB532B9D1A4A0DACC.description:
Examine and summarize how
chemistry affects soil structure and function
(e.g., pH, cation-exchange capacity, filtration
capability, flooding likelihood, etc.).

52F68A08B123424E9E98D852A0B05FD5.description: Apply chemistry principles to environmental service systems.

871632D5035C44879AAAF2E5CCF723D3.description:
Evaluate and select strategies
for wetlands preservation and restoration
that maximize services provided by wetlands
while taking human concerns into consideration.

52A6A19DCBD04E00956E7A6E01FB3C15.description:
Analyze the importance of
the roles played by wetlands in regards to
water availability, prevention of flooding and
other factors.

3046F38F08CC48F48A0EA91A1E404F8C.description:
Research and describe how
groundwater and surface water interactions
affect the existence of wetlands.

AA5B7308ABCB426E8FABF14CD73F2ED0.description:
Construct explanations and
solutions to situations involving the declining
availability of water that incorporate
groundwater flow equations as well as human
activity.

49EC41E23FCA42DC9E6E8753A2D49AB8.description:
Analyze how interactions between
groundwater and surface water affect
flow and availability of water.

623A1CBED5C44AF7936B6ECE6709BF3E.description:
Research and summarize
hydrogeology and differentiate between
groundwater and surface water.

EE574A51D49A44BA970FD5BA869441A0.description:
Evaluate the methods used
in a given example to protect groundwater
supplies.

F6C2A151BC3847E1A8C7FAC1F55BE6AE.description:
Assess the effectiveness of
precautions taken to prevent or reduce contamination
of groundwater supplies.

129E219FE64247349983BF43AE5FB5BE.description:
Summarize environmental
hazards associated with groundwater supplies.

E33183CA48F7477B8370101A60621193.description:
Conduct tests of soil to determine
its potential for filtration of groundwater
supplies and likelihood for flooding.

A0820DC45DA14206972E62B08642561A.description:
Assess the physical qualities
of the soil that determine its potential for
filtration of groundwater supplies and likelihood
for flooding.

FA469E2FADE9452FBAD67D3FE83F7656.description:
Examine and explain how
the physical qualities of the soil influence the
infiltration and percolation of water.

929A16BB807F46A7BE73D6A140E40634.description:
Evaluate the soil composition
in order to predict the impact of that soil on
environmental service systems.

788D928721464218885C131044BAAD90.description:
Differentiate rock types and
relate the chemical composition of mineral
matter in soils to the parent material.

BA3ED933B19E42E684EFD65058281222.description:
Research and describe the
process of soil formation through weathering.

0D42A3B5199048E7B22166E0B1D08BB0.description:
Design a master land-use
management plan for a given area that utilizes
land capability classes in order to minimize
erosion and flooding, maximize development
and preservation of topsoil, et cetera.

D0B2BFB74886489B8A92B7C36A261AA8.description:
Use a soil survey to determine
the land capability classes for different
parcels of land in an area.

6E4BCA1928CB421DA0DF3982B795C902.description:
Differentiate and distinguish
land uses, capability factors and land capability
classes.

853CDADDEF6B489180C1FCBDAA6FA254.description: Apply soil science and hydrology principles to environmental service systems.

7FDDA10FD60144D2B27A8FA01D07806F.description:
Utilize data to predict and
forecast future levels of greenhouse gas pollution
and outline steps necessary to mitigate
the resulting damage.

3F4FC220549749CC95779A29460B5515.description:
Analyze the basics of the
greenhouse effect and describe how the
greenhouse effect alters the earth’s balance
of energy.

F18A8F2BF1F94724A5BC62FA58A90D90.description:
Examine and summarize factors
that affect the earth’s balance of energy.

CF57DDB68A964DF68CCF0C14E68CE2CB.description:
Evaluate the predicted
impacts of global climate change on environmental
service systems.

3A183A2C13A34378BAE5DEC5810F1ABA.description:
Assess the environmental,
economic and social consequences of climate
change.

338CB3EC143041D4B15227663AC4EB18.description:
Research climate change and
summarize evidence that climate change is
occurring.

51C01AB13D6D40E4ADA7C9E47634952A.description:
Interpret data measuring air
pollution to determine its threat on human
populations and ecological interactions.

EBFC149E95E546D5B951DD6E9D2690AF.description:
Analyze and articulate the
relationship between meteorological conditions,
air quality and air pollutants.

D95A8C72D7DF49FB8499F9FE886C6529.description:
Analyze how meteorological
conditions influence air quality.

DB165A58CB7F45A1A754D3ED69B94C2B.description:
Utilize meteorological data to
assess the impact of atmospheric conditions
on environmental service systems.

4447202A4A12444799AC7EE8DBA6ECA5.description:
Differentiate how components
of the atmosphere (e.g., weather
systems and patterns, structure of the atmosphere,
etc.) affect environmental service
systems.

20CC45D975CE4BC393D7208FEC249A1D.description:
Distinguish between the
different components and structural layers of
the earth’s atmosphere.

C3331AF654424E729924C6D474883D5E.description: Apply meteorology principles to environmental service systems.

26B0E90C9F4D474AA6C2D5B399037D5E.description:
Develop proposed solutions to environmental issues, problems and
applications using scientific principles of meteorology, soil science, hydrology,
microbiology, chemistry and ecology.

4B63519B723D4D62BED9395C8A633845.description:
Research current issues related
to modern or future environmental service
systems and devise strategies for engaging
the public to address these issues through
social movements.

996C1FDCF4E34C5CB0947FFA2E988BBF.description:
Assess the effectiveness of
specific social movements related to regulation
of environmental service systems.

F573FAA873C3449ABD2F18F50D396DC0.description:
Examine how social views
and movements (e.g., zero-waste philosophy,
carbon footprints, recycling, etc.) have affected
the implementation and need for regulation
of environmental service systems.

5664284CCDED4D4AA5D0860BE8D1A205.description:
Evaluate the impact of specific
historical figures, or organizations, on the
perception and regulation of environmental
service systems.

26555D79A4A6488E8BBAAABB4A3B6EDC.description:
Analyze and summarize specific
changes to perceptions and regulations
of environmental service systems and their
impact on reducing the ecological, economical
and sociological impact.

6615BFACF4AA4B82B543B59712CE0F7D.description:
Research and summarize how
the perception and regulation of environmental
service systems has changed over time.

308BDABBAB8B441A9F4F9BC0F24F284A.description:
Examine and summarize the impact of public perceptions and social movements on
the regulation of environmental service systems.

F50BAE8AFBF04E8AAAA8D9CEC7F63A13.description:
Evaluate current fracking
policies and create suggestions for modification
of these policies to more thoroughly
address the needs related to environmental,
economic and social sustainability.

FEB4D40DDB0B4EC7A25EF70F3D033161.description:
Assess whether current
policies related to fracking and shale oil gas
sufficiently address the needs of environmental
service systems.

92A9F9E2A8DC4E82AD49480BB82586DF.description:
Research current policies
related to fracking and shale oil gas.

FB504205823D470997D40473683F7D45.description:
Predict the impact of future
population growth on the regulation of
environmental service systems and evaluate
how changes made today will impact future
regulations.

C5BFB4D1BF09431CA95C628ABCCBAE51.description:
Analyze the correlation
between increased population size and the
need for regulation of environmental service
systems.

B25CFB80626248949ACD82A80AB308BE.description:
Examine and summarize the
impact that population growth has on environmental
service systems

E16D5CC3266C451E98C6DFF2B9CA7920.description:
Interpret and evaluate the
impact of specific environmental service
